article.title: ATLASGAL-selected massive clumps in the inner Galaxy: V. Temperature structure and evolution

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red line in the plot represent?
choices: Observed spectrum
Individual K components
Best fit model
Noise level

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the green and blue lines indicate in the CH3CN plot?
choices: Blue: CH3CCH contamination, Green: CH3OH contamination
Blue: 13CH3CN isotopologue, Green: K components of CH3CN
Blue: Noise level, Green: Best fit model
Blue: Individual velocity components, Green: Average velocity

multiple_choice_question.text: Why are some lines not reproduced by the model in the CH3OH plot?
choices: These lines belong to the νt = 2 torsional state.
These lines are too faint to be detected.
These lines are excluded from the fit due to contamination.
These lines are affected by strong absorption.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which tracer shows the narrowest linewidth (FWHM) distribution?
choices: CH3CN
CH3OH
CO
CH3CCH

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the Spearman correlation coefficient (ρ) of 0.80 indicate?
choices: A weak negative correlation between CH3CN and CH3CCH temperatures.
A strong positive correlation between CH3CN and CH3CCH temperatures.
No correlation between CH3CN and CH3CCH temperatures.
The temperatures are identical for both species.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the physical interpretation of the minimum at ~20 K in the CO isotopologue temperature distribution?
choices: It indicates the average temperature of the entire sample.
It represents the temperature at which CO is efficiently removed from the gas phase by freezing onto dust grains.
It signifies the point at which the feedback from young stellar objects becomes dominant.
It shows the typical temperature of hot cores.
